com.poesys.db.dao.insert
Interface IInsertCollection<T extends IDbDto>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of IDbDto to insert
All Known Implementing Classes:
InsertCacheCollection, InsertCacheNoKeyCollection, InsertCollection, InsertMemcachedCollection, InsertMemcachedNoKeyCollection, InsertNoKeyCollection
public interface IInsertCollection<T extends IDbDto>

An interface for a Command pattern class that inserts a collection of objects into the database in one group.

The logic of tree insertion requires that certain nested objects be inserted while others are not. Only objects that cannot exist without the object being inserted should also be inserted. The following kinds of nested object should have a corresponding ISet command associated with the field:

  • A composite object or collection of objects; that is, parent-child relationships or ownership relationships
  • An association object or collection of objects as opposed to the associated objects; this object represents the association itself, and the parent object owns the relationship.

Only those association objects where all associated objects other than the current object are already inserted in the database should be inserted, as otherwise you will get a foreign key failure. The ISet command must check the associated objects for database status using the isNew method on the IDto.

Author:
Robert J. Muller
See Also:
ISet, IDbDto

          Close any resources allocated by the Command.

Method Detail

insert

void insert(java.sql.Connection connection,
            java.util.Collection<T> dtos)
            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                   BatchException
Insert the contents of a collection of new DTO objects into the database.

Parameters:
connection - the database connection with which to insert the data
dtos - the data transfer object (DTO) containing the objects to insert into the database; the key data members must have values; the method will insert only DTOs with isNew() = true
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a SQL error with the insert
BatchException - when a setter within a class in the collection has a problem, indicating one of the children of the object has thrown a SQLException

close

void close()
Close any resources allocated by the Command.
